0: AP Photo Hillary in bold: Hillvetica typeface goes viral NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Hillary Clinton has been a a first lady, a senator, and a diplomat, but this week she transformed into a whole new political form: a font. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Graphic designer Rick Wolff designed a font based on the newly-launched Hillary for America campaign’s logo, a blue ‘H’ with a red arrow pointing rightwards. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Story Continued Below NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He tweeted the font out Monday, dubbing it “Hillary Bold” and later “Hillvetica” — a play on the Swiss typeface Helvetica which has become subtly omnipresent across the world since launching in the 1950s. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “Because, America. Now you too can announce!” Wolff quipped in a Tweet. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Already, in the absence of a Microsoft Word-compatible version, the Washington Post has launched a Hillvetica slogan-generator and legions of online political junkies have created their own slogans.
